subject: [Radiance-general] Radiance within Mac OSX
body:
Hi!


That's true, however, if this was the problem, he should simply get the
wrong program (vi) started, no such error message.


By the way, did you check if this library exists on your system? Try:
ls /usr/X11R6/lib/libX11.6.*

The file is there on my OS X 10.3.6 machine and should be installed if
you have X11-support!

One more hint, you can perfectly remote-control linux- and other
ix-machines from your OS X laptop using ssh, even X11-windows can be
redirected to your laptop. IMHO it's better to use "real" computers for
large renderings, I don't like to overheat my laptop by having 100% cpu
for hours...

I will make some 3.6 binaries and provide them on my binary-pages as
soon as I find the time.

CU Lars.
